website_summaries.verdict: You can definitely find basic HD live-streaming security cameras for less, but the $150 Kodak V20's 180-degree view, free storage, IFTTT channel and optional add-ons give it an edge over some of its $200+ competition.
pros: Kodak's $150 Video Monitor CFH-V20 has a wide-angle 180-degree lens, free 24-hour activity-based cloud storage, an IFTTT channel, a USB connector for adding a battery pack accessory and optional people detection capabilities for a monthly fee
cons: The V20's two-way talk feature has poor audio quality, it doesn't offer sound alerts or local storage and the fee-based people-detection feature can't identify specific people, only that someone (rather than something) has passed in front of the camera's field of view

customer_reviews.title: Skip this camera
customer_reviews.text: Skip this camera. I purchased two of them back in April 2017. I sent one back to Amazon two weeks later when it stopped working. Amazon was great, send it back and we will replace it. Replacement camera went bad this week after 7 months. I went through the support nonsense and in the end I am sending it back to them for replacement. My reasons for buying were: Kodak is an American company trying to reinvent itself and the free 24 hour cloud storage. Amazon just announced a camera that works with your Echo Show. Probably the way I would go. I don't have a Show, but there is one in my future
customer_reviews.author: Peter I. Davitt

customer_reviews.title: + Reasonably easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: + Reasonably easy to set up. + Decent field of view. + Free 1 day recording history. - Almost always in low-light (black & white) mode, even in a fairly well lit room. - Very sensitive to motion to start an event recording, but stops recording after a few seconds unless the motion is exaggerated. - Stops working randomly and has to be rebooted (unplugged). - App interface is a little clunky.
customer_reviews.author: CGI-BIN

customer_reviews.title: Quality only good for like 5 feet away
customer_reviews.text: This is more like a baby monitor . It it very good quality when objects are close by but further away look horrible faces are unrecognizable the 1 day free cloud cool but not worth if it looks like crap. I was using amcrest ip2m 841 but it would stop uploading to cloud as you get 4 free hours,I'll just try another one and return this.
customer_reviews.author: Wilder

customer_reviews.title: second one failed too - not good
customer_reviews.text: I have a second one of these now and it has failed in less than six months. The first one was replaced after just over a year old. The replacement didn't even make it six months. Very disappointing. I have friends whom paid far less and have no problems for cameras years old! I would think Kodak would engineer a better product!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Keep Looking.
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes works, sometimes doesn't. When it does work the feed is delayed a long time and the video quality is very poor.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Great camera. Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Easy to set up, easy to view. The image is clear, zoom-able, and the audio is acceptable. The voice back to the camera doesn't work too well. If this was cheaper, I'd buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas A.

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! Have it pointing to the front of the house, and really enjoy a peace of mind knowing that nothing suspicious happening near my house when I am away. I use People only filter to get notifications in case a person walks by.
customer_reviews.author: Evgenia Yuzhakova

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup, just don't place it in view of the wind of bushes or trees. The movement of leaves causes false notifications, but things like fish tanks and slow-walking animals don't have an effect.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Easy to set up. 5 minutes, just follow the directions. Very clear image even the night vision (black and white) is clear. Audio is fair. In two months and zero issues.
customer_reviews.author: thomas r mcleod

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup and works flawlessly every time. Purchased another one.
customer_reviews.author: JEH

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier with this product and the software package
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be happier with this product and the software package. Super easy to set up; great video quality; mobile alerts; good free and pay storage options.
customer_reviews.author: Mahl Zeit

customer_reviews.title: In general terms it is a good camera, good viewing angle
customer_reviews.text: In general terms it is a good camera, good viewing angle, a free day everything is recorded online, the bad I have two cameras equal these and usually freeze every few days need to disconnect and reconnect, I also have this other camera that never freezes and for over a year I have them and never failed
customer_reviews.author: Maza

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Does not work and they would not let me return it ...
customer_reviews.author: Chris Dicecca

customer_reviews.title: The 180deg view is amazing. And the EASIEST setup of ANY CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: Tried several different cameras. The 180deg view is amazing. And the EASIEST setup of ANY CAMERA. The Amcrest was so complicated couldn't configure it. The Coolcam sucked as well. THIS IS A TRUE PLUG AND PLAY SECURITY CAM. took 3 minutes to set up AND works with IFTTT UPDATE: Returned Camera due to not wanting to pay for a subscription cost FOREVER!!! ALMOST perfect camera if had an SD card or free cloud
customer_reviews.author: Infinitiboi

customer_reviews.title: Good security camera
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. Wide viewing angle 2. Small size 3. Price is reasonable especially with the free 1 day event storage on cloud. 4. Adjustable motion sensitivity. 5. Uses standard micro usb cable for power. So, I was able to buy a 20 ft micro usb cable from Amazon to extend the reach. 6. Easy setup. 7. Good night view mode. Cons: 1. Motion detection too sensitive even at the lowest level. isecurity+ has a monthly plan which is only $4 to filter out events that are not caused by people. I have not tried that yet.
customer_reviews.author: Karthik

customer_reviews.title: One more layer of security
customer_reviews.text: My senior parents live in another state and had property stolen outside. Dad's garage has windows and is loaded with tools as he restores cars. Out of concern of thieves returning to hit the garage I set up this camera. If an event occurs we can access the cloud and recover footage.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The camera quality is great and is easy to getup and running .
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: I like this wifi camera
customer_reviews.text: I like this wifi camera. It's very compact. With 180degree view, I dont need to install multiple cameras to give me a wide range. It's easy to setup, you can zoom in with live view, turn speaker on/off and even talk back. It gives one free day cloud storage to avoid paying subscription. It even sends notification when motion is detected. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: setup was fast and easy. after a few legal incidents
customer_reviews.text: setup was fast and easy. after a few legal incidents, i've come to realize how indispensable these cameras are. the video file from this camera was the only evidence my neighbors could offer law enforcement. the hard lesson is that safeguarding has to be preemptive. consider the cost of a camera compared to replacing a car (you'll want cloud if your camera is stolen), power tools accumulated across several years, hiking gear, etc. most importantly, the sad reality is that the police are only as helpful as the evidence you can present.
customer_reviews.author: wally chu

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Like the fancy USB design, and one day free storage, save some $$. Both video and audio quality are impressive, and the ultra wide view is also a very interesting thing.
customer_reviews.author: Lei Li

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed.....
customer_reviews.text: This was a great setup in the beginning. After about 3 days, I decided to move the the monitor in another room. I have not been able to reset the monitor despite following directions from ISECURITY+ and Kodak. I am beyond disappointed and feel like I have wasted 150.00. I am willing to take any and all suggestions to make the monitor work. I will to attempt to return this product.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth D.

customer_reviews.title: 180-degree monitoring with free 1-day cloud storage makes it ideal
customer_reviews.text: Setup was super easy. The free 1-day cloud storage is a great extra benefit. The 180-degree monitoring makes it ideal for monitoring a whole room. Also I like the detachable USB feature which is quite unique.
customer_reviews.author: Jay W Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy for night vision use through a window.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to setup and the app is simple to use as well. The cloud storage is nice and easy to use for event capturing. Daylight footage is great. But IR night vision does not work when trying to view outside through a window. All you will see is the reflection of the camera off the glass of the window, rendering it useless at night. This is not an issue with the product, but an issue of physics I should of thought of before I purchased. IR will not pass through a window.
customer_reviews.author: Salad252

customer_reviews.title: Must use their service to view
customer_reviews.text: This camera MUST be used with Kodak's supplied service. You CAN NOT use this by directly connecting to it on your network and using your own cam software.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It got the job done, until they jacked the ...
customer_reviews.text: It got the job done, until they jacked the fees up 90%. Did not grandfather in current customers. I ditched mine as it sent over 200 notifications a day to my phone for real and imagined movement.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: For about 6 months this worked great then it stopped connecting. Next to impossible to reconnect to WiFi. I security app won’t connect to it either. Don’t waster your money!
customer_reviews.author: G R

customer_reviews.title: The older version is better
customer_reviews.text: I have the older Kodak camera and it works better than this one. The night vision is way to dark, and I have it set to record on montion, and it does not always recored. I bought this to watch over my dog while I’m away since I’m in an appartment I can refrance back to recordings if I need to. This was the upgrade to the one I already own and like, but I am disapointed in this upgraded version.
customer_reviews.author: Tawny

product_meta.title: Kodak CFH-V20-180-Degree Panoramic HD WiFi Video Monitoring Surveillance Security Camera, Two-Way Audio, Night Vision & Free Cloud Storage
product_meta.description: The Tend Insights V-Series Video Monitors help you stay connected to the people, places and pets that you value most-no matter where you are. Now all Tend Insights V-Series Video Monitors include Lifetime 1-Day Cloud Storage; recorded motion-triggered video clips from the past 24 hours are stored in the cloud so you can rest assured that you’ll never miss a moment. The Tend Insights Video Monitor CFH-V20 is the latest addition to the Tend Insights V-Series product line. Boasting a one-of-a-kind detachable USB camera, 180 Degree whole room field of view and Wide Dynamic Range (WDR), the V20 offers unrivaled portability and performance. Check in on loved ones with smooth HD streaming video, crisp two-way audio, and automatic night vision via the free iSecurity+ app (iOS, Android). Motion-triggered notifications are automatically sent to your mobile device for real-time alerts. The state-of-the-art low lux CMOS imaging sensor w/cutting edge IR filters offers exceptional daylight images w/vibrant colors and powerful night vision performance. Now with the availability of the IFTTT (If This Then That) iSecurity+ Channel, users can connect their V20 Wi-Fi camera with other devices or apps for added automation. The iSecurity+ Channel supports the entire line of Tend Insights V-Series Video Monitors.
feature_bullets: Lifetime 1-Day Cloud Storage - Look back on recorded video clips from the past 24 hours (included)
180-degree view - See the entire room in stunning HD video quality during the day or at night
Wide Dynamic Range - Enjoy enhanced image quality in scenes with extreme lighting conditions
Motion-triggered notifications - Get alerts delivered instantly to your smartphone or tablet
Premium plans - Reduce false alarms with Smart Detection, 14-Day or 30-Day Cloud Storage plans

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.3 out of 5 stars45 ratings3.3 out of 5 stars
